attributes.action: Hold Bank of Scotland accountable:  mis-selling of Shared Appreciation Mortgages
attributes.additional_details:
Correspondence with:
Financial Conduct Authority
Financial Ombudsman
Chair of the Treasury Committee
MP for Outer York
Group Executive Officer of Lloyds Bank
attributes.background:
Between 1996 & 1998 Bank of Scotland mis-sold shared appreciation mortgages. Aimed at vulnerable pensioners, now in their 80s.  Result: now trapped in homes with insufficient equity to buy another as liable to pay 50% / 75% of appreciation to the bank.
________________________________________

rejection.details: This would be the responsibility of the Financial Conduct Authority, which is independent of the Government and Parliament.
